subject: RE: [junit] Request for better questions
msgSnippet: An agreeable sentiment, but a waste of bytes because anyone who is going to ask the type of question you described is not going to bother looking through the
messageBody:
An agreeable sentiment, but a waste of bytes because anyone who is going
to ask the type of question you described is not going to bother looking
through the history to find your post.

You can at least have fun with it. We have a weekly "Stupidest JUnit
question" contest at work. Most weeks there's an embarrasment of riches
to choose from.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Sent: Sunday, March 30, 2003 9:20 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Request for better questions
>
>
> Everyone:
>
> Before you ask a question like "How do I test XXX with
> JUnit", please ask yourself the following question: how is
> testing XXX different from testing a plain Java class? If you
> cannot find a difference, then you have your answer. If you
> find an answer, please describe your answer along with your question.
>
> Although we are here to help people learn to use JUnit
> effectively, we are not here to be pro bono consultants.
>
> It's just a question of common courtesy.
>
> Thanks.
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> President, Diaspar Software Services
> Let's write software that people understand.
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
> telephone: +1 416 791-8603
